title: How to watch college football free live stream today : Colorado Buffaloes vs . Utah Utes | Streameast , crackstreams , methstreams , buffstreams alternatives
body_text:
The final game of the night after tons of college football action on Saturday, Oct. 25 pits the Utah Utes against the Colorado Buffaloes at Rice-Eccles Stadium in Salt Lake City.
The game is scheduled to start at 10:15 p.m. EDT and will be broadcast on ESPN. Fans looking to watch this college football game can do so for free by using DirecTV, which offers a free trial. FuboTV offers up to $30 off your first month. SlingTV doesn’t offer a free trial but has promotional offers available for streaming the game. You can stream ESPN Unlimited on your phone, tablet, smart TV or gaming console, and bundle your plan with NFL+ Premium or with NFL+ Premium, Disney+ and Hulu. Additionally, those with DirecTV, FuboTV or Hulu + Live TV can access ESPN Unlimited through their package.
Utah is 5-2 with both losses coming in the Big 12, including last week on the road against BYU. The Utes fell 24-21 last week, dropping them from the rankings as 244 passing yards and two touchdowns along with 64 rushing yards from quarterback Devon Dampier wasn’t enough, even with an additional 121 rushing yards and a score on 10 carries from Daniel Bray.
Colorado is 3-4, but last week the Buffaloes picked up their first Big 12 win of the season, a 24-17 victory over then-No. 22 Iowa State, who also fell from the rankings with a loss. QB Kaidon Salter had 255 passing yards, 57 rushing yards and two scores through the air to help stop a two-game losing streak.
Who: Colorado Buffaloes vs. Utah Utes
When: Saturday, Oct. 25 at 10:15 p.m. EDT
Where: Rice-Eccles Stadium in Salt Lake City
Stream: DirecTV (free trial); FuboTV; SlingTV; ESPN
Betting: Check out our MA sports betting guide, where you can learn basic terminology, definitions and how to read odds for those interested in learning how to bet in Massachusetts.
What is DirecTV?
DirecTV is an internet TV service that offers your favorite entertainment, news and sports channels, as well as local TV stations and regional sports networks. Sign up now and get three free months of premium channels including HBO Max, Paramount+ with SHOWTIME and Starz.
What is FuboTV?
FuboTV is an internet television service that offers more than 200 channels across sports and entertainment including Paramount+ with SHOWTIME. From the UEFA Champions League to the WNBA to international tournaments ranging across sports, there’s plenty of options available on FuboTV, which offers up to $30 off the first month for new customers.
What is Sling TV?
Sling TV offers a variety of live programming ranging from news and sports and starting as low as $20 a month for your first month. Subscribers also get a month of DVR Plus free if they sign up now. Choose from a variety of sports packages without long-term contracts and with easy cancellation.
What is ESPN?
ESPN is a one-stop shop for content from almost every single sport. In addition to on-demand replays of games across all sports shown on the ESPN and Disney family of networks, there is also exclusive access to select college football games, NHL games, soccer matches, UFC programs, WWE premium live events and the entire 30 for 30 catalogue. Additionally, there is ESPN+ exclusive original programming like NFL Primetime and Dana White’s Contender Series. You can stream ESPN+ on your phone, tablet, smart TV or gaming console for $12.99/month or bundle with Disney+ and Hulu for just $19.99 per month. You can also stream ESPN Unlimited on any of those devices, and bundle your plan with NFL+ Premium or with NFL+ Premium, Disney+ and Hulu. Additionally, those with DirecTV, FuboTV or Hulu + Live TV can access ESPN Unlimited through their package.
